de.unlixx.runpng.bitmap

Class Bitmap32

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unlixx.runpng.bitmap.Bitmap32

  • public class Bitmap32
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple ARGB bitmap object with an optional PngFrameControl object for APNG use.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int[] m_anPixels 
      (package private) PngFrameControl m_fcTL 
      (package private) int m_nHeight 
      (package private) int m_nWidth

      Constructs a Bitmap32 object.
      Bitmap32(int nWidth, int nHeight)
      Constructs a transparent Bitmap32 object.
      Bitmap32(PngFrameControl fcTL, int[] anPixels)
      Constructs a Bitmap32 object with dimensions based on a given PngFrameControl object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bitmap32

        public Bitmap32(int nWidth,
                int nHeight)
        Constructs a transparent Bitmap32 object.
        Parameters:
        nWidth - An int with the width value.
        nHeight - An int with the height value.

      • Bitmap32

        public Bitmap32(int[] anPixels,
                int nWidth,
                int nHeight)
        Constructs a Bitmap32 object.
        Parameters:
        anPixels - An int array with the initial pixels. If null then a transparent pixel array of width x height will be created. Afterwards the given pixel array will be copied. If it is shorter than width x height, then the copy will be padded by zeros. If it is longer then the copy will be truncated.
        nWidth - An int with the width value.
        nHeight - An int with the height value.

      • Bitmap32

        public Bitmap32(PngFrameControl fcTL,
                int[] anPixels)
        Constructs a Bitmap32 object with dimensions based on a given PngFrameControl object.
        Parameters:
        fcTL - A PngFrameControl object.
        anPixels - An int array with the initial pixels. If null then a transparent pixel array of width x height will be created. Afterwards the given pixel array will be copied. If it is shorter than width x height, then the copy will be padded by zeros. If it is longer then the copy will be truncated.

    • Method Detail

      • getPixels

        public int[] getPixels()
        Gets access to the ARGB pixel array.
        Returns:
        An int array with the bitmap pixels.

        Gets the width of this bitmap object.

        fcTL - A PngFrameControl object.

      • getFrameControl

        public PngFrameControl getFrameControl()
        Gets the PngFrameControl of this bitmap if any.
        Returns:
        A PngFrameControl object. Or null if not set.
